column4: Hey, newbie question here, I'm trying to install some variant of snes9x on my netbook, compaq 311C, lubuntu 11.10, new install
I'm finding it difficult, most repositories seem to be out of date on either the build or the version of ubuntu to which they refer
I keep finding references to gsnes9x, but it seems the ubuntu repositories don't have this package, terminal says package not found
I've got a tar.bz2 I can find, of course, but I'm rather hopeless with such things
and I'd prefer a graphical frontend, I believe the vanilla snes9x releases are command line
snes9x is in the repos (or zsnes)
so you dont need the tar.gz
- not a fan of zsnes, and apt-get snes9x or gsnes9x says package not found
yes, only zsnes is in the repos
download the tar.gz, right click -> extraxt. extract it in your home and then start the snes9x script
ok. Is there a graphical frontend I can use with it?
for extracting?
or for snes9x itself?
it has a gui by default
Ah, I've been informed otherwise. Let me install and see who's correct
Hmm. I ran the script, it asks me whether I want to execute it, I choose execute in terminal, and nothing happens
is this because I'm using lubuntu? do I need the gtk packages?
can you paste me the url to the tar.gz?
so i can check it here
sorry url is blocked here :(
bo problem
